content: Thank you for this article! I definitely understand the importance of white space in showing clarity, no matter what form of design we’re doing. I just hope that clients will soon be able to understand this importance of white space, rather than try to clutter all their demands into one page. I used to work for an advertising firm who was designing the UI for a travel website. They made sure to include the basic white space, but the client ended up requesting a whole bunch of shit to be added and we went along with it, making the web page harder to read. I just feel it’s our duty as designers to remind and educate clients of basic design principles.
